YHLY0R9HNzu8RSRHtq6rIQ.text: Finally - authentic Ramen in Charlotte!  Noodles made fresh on site.  Try the spicy Tonkatsu - delicious!  Congratulations on opening a legit Ramen restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Tonkatsu

QbpcUWQkNIT7mruxPnsgVw.text: Some of the best ramen toppings I've had. Loved the spicy chili paste combined with the wood ear mushrooms and corn in my Tonkotsu. The broth was savory but not too heavy and the pork had a delectable sear! We'll definitely make this our go-to for ramen when visiting Charlotte.

gGIRUGE9syU3ORwDxDbPgQ.text: A pleasant surprise. Excellent pork, great noodles and some of the most tasty broth I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen

2ZYc5FLP1mePVsOh6Eazww.text: Run, don't walk!   This was amazing and we are so happy to have it in Ballantyne.  I had the curry ramen and it was wonderful!

HsXsLWicGSa3A45_qDc6Ow.text: We love this new Ramen restaurant in Ballantyne!  It is our go to for excellent Ramen. We recently had Ramen in NYC and this was just as good!

8nd9fhCriut3PrhsRDPxsA.text: Absolutely love this place.  Great staff and wonderful food.  One of the few places in the area you can get takoyaki.  The Ramen is always great as well.

9pOUOZFnhxQLBlW7yC8_nQ.text: I came here during a late lunch. Service was amazing and the ramen was better. The dumpling are also amazing, the best I've had! You can tell they are made fresh everyday. So good. I highly recommend!

XG_CSPHp3ekhKF1JQjzdlw.text: Tasty, I've had more flavorful broths but the pork belly was deliciously grilled. The egg was a little nasty (but I am weird about eggs). The gyozas were good as well. Just know they're menu isn't that big, so not much variety. Staff is nice, good ambiance!

f7OAggyQV88nzGEwgL-INA.text: Was really happy with our experience at Sheng Ramen! It opened recently but you would never know it. We got gyoza and tonkotsu ramen and both were delicious

UkXSrwejSZyIOTQVWBd88g.text: Best ramen in Charlotte. The service was fast and friendly, and the Tonkatsu was perfect. Our favorite new place in Ballantyne!

QIvCBNXO4LCjSIxXG8k5Ew.text: I have been to every ramen shop Charlotte has to offer and Prior to Sheng opening, I was let down by overpriced trendy restaurants that offer long waits, high prices, and bad food. I believe this is the best ramen in town. Service is fast and the food is consistently great. I have had the Tonkaotsu, Shoyu, and Spicy Miso. All of these were great; however the Spicy Miso is my favorite. I try and stop in once a week. I am so glad Charlotte finally has a good ramen spot. No if only the could open one closer to my house.

qT90PtzLqTUSf9DwYzff1A.text: Great food,  good service! 3 choices of ramen as well as other dishes. Love the pork belly bun!

FdyMhwbZtOu1XYBhNXXAsA.text: The broth was tasty without being cloying, and the ingredients (particularly the pork in the shoyu) were well prepared. We really only had two complaints: it should *not* cost $1 for chili paste, and the ladle-style spoons are an annoying conceit. We'll definitely be back, despite that.

z2Qjtfq61fppRVHxxh8oZQ.text: All I can say is WOW!!!!!!! I am so stoked this place is open. I have order from here TWICE today! I WILLbe back and I'm telling everyone about it!!!!! Fantastic job! And the staff is extremely friendly and knowledgeable!

58rWMpwlO3DT5rcU53VbnQ.text: Very good ramen for Charlotte. Other stuff was pretty tasty as well. Didn't try all the other dishes,  but they were fair to good.

wy9WaH4QPPvlB3nInOrLqg.text: Ramen in Ballantyne!! They also have bento boxes which my kids love. Great service too!!!

qBL9ZyLrKmyJboKp6J0v8A.text: Best Ramen I've had in Charlotte. Great quality not too salty. Will definitely be going back again!

msGJD0Q-RPVfTVykcwmNmA.text: My husband wanted Ramen so we tried this restaurant. I ordered a Bento box. His order came and it was fine, but by the time he finished, mine still had not arrived.  She kept telling us another couple of minutes. We finally asked for the check and THEN she brought out mine. I had already eaten the rest of his and was no longer hungry, so I refused. She threw the check at us. Wow.

Nm23hXdg3aqueLwb0U_nSQ.text: The Tonkotsu ramen I had was great, especially with the spicy chili paste. And the service was fantastic. I'll definitely be back!

cB3lQrCgmbuQOCizm8Sbmw.text: We were excited to try out this new ramen place, although we are still hoping for one closer to home, this was great! Service was very nice.. we went for lunch and luckily we didn't have to wait too long. The food was delicious! We tried the Ramen bowls, Pork Bao and the Bento box and all were so yummy! Perfectly seasoned as well. Prices are a little on the expensive side but the portion sizes are generous for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ramen
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bento box
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

MNqdSMb6mimJUtGW5fKBXw.text: Oh. My. God. This place is amazing. My sister and I were in town late on a Friday and just wanted to grab something to take to the hotel. This food was beyond what you would expect from takeout.

Mfz5x2v-dcILxxojsTFsrQ.text: Awesome! If you're looking for a bowl of goodness this is the place! I ordered the pork belly ramen and it was delicious!

UC-fgIZOflQfg4nOQQ91bA.text: Tonkatsu Ramen and Curry Ramen were good - Curry Ramen slightly better :)  The food came out really fast despite having a full house on a Saturday night.  Our servers were friendly. They also have a full bar with Japanese whiskeys.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Ramen with extra eggs
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken yakitori

tGV4njDm4tOJkCWIwPAuDA.text: Quaint little spot. Super yummy and friendly staff, cannot wait to return when the weather is cooler so I don't feel crazy for eating soup in 95 degree heat. Delicious!

kaY5yOI0YQMCXnHAzmg7Mw.text: It's a really good place it's clean and the decor is simple and cute. the workers are nice and the food is amazing. I had the ramen and it was cooked and seasoned well.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. It was really good

7i3pcwRYyQBqNR42aqUN9w.text: Amazing! The curry ramen and gyoza were both amazing. Worth the wait.... so good I'm afraid we won't get a table as soon as the word gets out! Exactly what Ballantyne needed!! Thank you Sheng!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

pr4m242CRbeNSVZwrZ1CJg.text: First of all this place is way over priced for Ramen noodles.   I ordered the Shoyu Ramen because that what you order when going to a ramen shop that you've never been before to judge the quality and skill of the chef/owner.   Although it wasn't bad. It wasn't worth $13. I would only charge $10 at the most for the flavors they was producing.   They even use the wrong bowls to serve ramen. The bowls they use was meant for soba noodles. That goes to tell you that the owner has no clue of what is ramen.   Going back to the shoyu ramen. It lacked flavor. More so the base broth lacked any real flavor and they counted on the shoyu base to flavor everything. The combination of the shoyu tare & the broth make a good soup. If one is not right, then you're better off eating instant ramen for cheaper price.

SbNBVxvxYkGPO_-f8IlFUA.text: I ordered the spicy miso. It was pretty good, lots of flavors! We also ordered the pork belly bun which was delicious. Def will come back again and try their other options!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy miso ramen

da1-fh8XizkLxUQjKF_OwA.text: Shemg Ramen has finally opened after weeks and weeks of waiting. Very nice staff and the decor is very inviting. Still waiting on the beer license but that is happening nytile now. I tried the Spicy miso and my girlfriend had the Chicken Hot Pot which she loved. I will certainly be returning to try the other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

oG3oCDCiRXy5xatCn1Z3dw.text: Truly hard to find authentic Asian food. Being that I grew up in South East Asia and had travelled throughout Asia most of my 20s, I find my palette hard to please. This place comes close. It is as good as it gets without having to fly 26 hours.

Tpn3cBaiIx_ts5v_WI5nWA.text: Ugh. Do yourself a favor and make the drive uptown to Futo Buta for some real deal ramen. I did not like this place at all. The ramen noodles that come in a pack are better than this joint.

SrkT2X7mlLSff9O2w5cGhQ.text: DELICIOUS! Flavorful broth. Tender, juicy meat. The Gyozo is perfectly fried on one side. It's the perfect crunch with the perfect bite. Service is as swift as it can be -- fresh, delicious food takes time. Visit. Eat. Savor. Enjoy!

1J4RuXlW0vphL3ZrNCFPTQ.text: We have tried several of the available ramen dishes and they have all been good and pretty distinct.  The tonkotsu was good although the pork was a little firmer than I prefer.  The curry was delicious. The chili paste option is a worthwhile upgrade since it really changes the flavor of the soups it is added to.  Get it on the side if you are wary of spicy things.

crBgJdCFXKYKdlldh276-Q.text: We were thrilled with our experience at Sheng Ramen!  An unexpected jewel!  We tried the Takoyaki and it was delicious!  Great flavor and texture.  We then tried the Tonkotsu Ramen and the Curry Ramen.  Both were amazing!  The broth was very flavorful and the braised pork belly and the Chicken Katsu added another dimension.  Good prices, nice atmosphere.  We will definitely be back!

8T7QdfdJbEW3MX7YNPHxFg.text: The food was fantastic. This is a welcome addition to the restaurants that we have here in South Charlotte. I have been waiting for a good Ramen spot to open up in Ballantyne in this place definitely hits the mark. Very authentic, And the service was outstanding.

jF0jTGbj3upBZGTHHLsFqg.text: We've known Be, and been following her around Charlotte, since 1993.  Every restaurant that she has owned has been excellent.  And Sheng Ramen is no exception.  Our favorite entrees last night were the Tonkotsu Ramen, Paitan Ramen (spicy), Curry Ramen, and the Beef Hot Pot.  The must-get appetizers would be the Gyoza and the Pork Belly Buns.  The Gyoza is the best that I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu Ramen
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Hot Pot

88GG4JLRauGoiPIBktz1rQ.text: Love this place. Spicy miso ramen and gyoza are amazing! Also give the plum wine a try!

9afyrI2igKt5qZ3ksK4L8Q.text: Loved it!!!  Beautiful restaurant with lovely, clean ambiance.   I had arguably the best ramen in Charlotte here. It's arguable. I'm not fully convinced but it's a contender for sure! I ordered the Tonkatsu and it was SO FLAVORFUL. I didn't want to stop eating!!!  I want to come back and try everything on the menu! This place is going to be very popular and probably very busy very soon. It's absolutely delicious.  This is my alternative to futobuta, which is also excellent but very crowded and small.  I can't wait to come back and try the takoyaki or the pork buns. Someone told me the pork buns are fantastic!   There aren't a ton of vegetarian options here but there are some... there's a vegetarian friendly broth and they have tofu yakisoba.  They also have delicious green tea mochi for dessert! So refreshing!  As for pricing, it's about the same cost-wise as other ramen places. ramen is around 12-14 dollars.  You can get out of here under 10 dollars if you're penny pinching but I think the next time I visit I'm going to have to do appetizer, entree and dessert, so that would be about 30-40 bucks here. I think it's worth it!  I can't think of anything else to put! Thanks for reading this far, go forth and eat ramen!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkatsu ramen

gN-d0Rxr7UkEQPwRJyf_lg.text: Pork belly buns 8/10 - I like the grilled taste of the pork and the aioli sauce drizzle but I prefer pickled radish over romaine lettuce   Ramen 6.5/10 - broth less flavorful than I thought. Not creamy, rich and salty enough. I prefer marinated bamboo and black wood ear mushroom over cabbage in my Tonkotsu ramen. However, the eggs were perfectly done and the portion was generous. Definitely shareable.   Ambience 9/10  Service 9/10  Price is average. $13-15 for a bowl of ramen. Pork buns 2/$9. Probably will spend at least $20 per person here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly buns 2/$9
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Yka-JA7nVMAkZtvFHdsYzg.text: Well, slap my face and call me Susan!  I think I found my ramen joint.  I'm a big fan of Futo Buta (downtown) but not wild about the higher price and difficult parking.  Sheng just fixed all that.  The Tonkotsu came out in about 6 minutes flat.  Perfect temperature to enjoy immediately. I also appreciate the care they took to prep the eggs separately and place them in last for the perfect, ramen egg consistency.  Broth was rich and I made it out under 15$ not counting tip.  On that note, the service was what service should be.  Not any wine and dine just prompt polite service.  Plenty of refills and though I did not imbibe they NOW HAVE ALCOHOL!  Excited to come back and try the rest!  Sincerely,  -Susan...I mean Dan.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkatsu (ordered spicy)
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice touch!

IC5fc7aCYbzSlt2cBakgdQ.text: Finally a decent ramen spot in Ballantyne! Gyoza is yummy.. the seasoned egg is  I always order a 2nd one.

NJmLaSkrJEjMmqBOQbrJgg.text: I've been craving ramen in Charlotte after moving from NY and Sheng has become my go to! Best part is it's in Ballantyne so I don't have to trek too far. I've tried the spring rolls, dumplings, spicy miso and curry (I added spicy paste to this too) ramen. They're all delicious. My friend had the veggie hot pot and she loved it. Large portions and so tasty that you want to push through and try finishing it all while you're there. Look forward to my next visit.

PriNgUqveQ66VYZsGHR9qw.text: Excellent service and the food was delicious! So great to have a nice spot to go to within 30 min of where we live in SC. Husband had curry ramen and I went with Tonkatsu. Both were tasty and the portions were generous. We saw others order many other dishes that we'll have to try when we return. We will definitely be back! Don't knock the shopping center/strip mall location, it was well worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu ramen

Ambrisi874XU-E0qgxeHSw.text: Best Ramen in Charlotte! I've tried three of their ramens so far - tonkotsu, shoyu, and the curry ramen. All three has been amazing and the prices are so much better than the other ramen places in Charlotte. The noodles are the perfect consistency and I love how it's a little chewy. All the broths has been really flavorful and the perfect amount of ingredients. I highly recommend them!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Yakitori
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoyu Ramen
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Ramen

spU-FoYqKTsrAPlse5ljRg.text: A new ramen place! We had gyoza, Pork ramen w/chili, and a katsu don bento box.   My husband proclaimed the katsu don extremely great. Highlight of the tonkotsu ramen for me was the broth (great mouth feel) and the pork belly, which was amazing. Tender and delicate and extremely tasty, not too fatty at all, def memorable.   We've been desperately missing pre-sell-out Yume. Does Sheng live up as a replacement?  The broth is definitely on point, so are the toppings for sure. I think this place serves up more variety. I like that the different ramen bowls have different toppings. My only disappointment was, I didn't think the noodles were anything special.. They were just fine, but I miss home made noodles. But I don't want to over critique - everything else was great. Worth repeat visits and will def recommend.  Ps Be warned if you get tonkatsu ramen with the spicy chili sauce (which I loved)... It's a lot of chili! They put a pile on top for you to mix in, so a smarter person than I would have scooped a little out. But I have pretty high spice tolerance so I was like NAH I'LL USE IT ALL AS CHEF INTENDED. It was very spicy :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu Ramen

Pt5N4yLS6XbNkeXcJUpr2A.text: My husband has been talking about Ramen since I met him and believe me it was s loooong time ago. He loves Naruto and from all I know Naruto eats a lot of ramen on the show so finally last night we decided to try it. I believe we got to the restaurant s little bit before 6pm, there were a few tables but they were not crazy busy yet. Their menu is pretty decent and everything looks to be good but we both decided to go with the same thing, first option of Ramen on their menu. (Sorry, forgot the name) my husband order a Japanese soda that was very sweet but at the same time good, tasted just like childhood. Our food came fast and it was sooooooo good. It was way better than I expected. The restaurant was well decorated and clean, our waitress was very friendly and attentive and as I said the food just delicious! Not long after we arrived a lot of people came in so if you want to beat the Saturday night dinner rush you might want to consider going a little bit before 6pm. My husband and I will definitely be back and this time we will try the hot pot!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry Ramune, Japanese soft drink. It tastes just like candy, very sweet and delicious if you like candy and soft drink.
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious Ramen, forgot the name but it is the first option on the menu

YtecZ6aHTe-fCFePYvbC3A.text: Love love love your noodles! Really wish you will open another location closer to uptown!!! How about South End or Optimist Hall in Noda!?

P9rYKfaVX44mN9efp08OLg.text: First time going on Friday. From start to finish everything was amazing. The food was as wonderful as the service. I will def be back to try more small plates and other ramen options!  Love this place!!

W3xadqPRHZMbf-G2w6m69A.text: Finally! Ramen in Ballantyne!  Today was their first day and we were so excited to pay them a visit after seeing the store front for the last couple of months! Try the Japanese soda and green tea, you won't be sorry!  We started with gyoza then had Spicy Miso Ramen and Shoyu Ramen and all of it was delicious! I was also impressed with how much food we got!  We'll probably be back tomorrow to try more - if so, additions will be made to this review for that trip too! Please pay them a visit so we can keep a good ramen shop in this area!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyoza, Spicy Miso Ramen, and Shoyu Ramen - all delicious!
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

K5rR86Ivp1HirCP4Md15ag.text: IT'S ABOUT TIME THIS PLACE OPENED UP!!! I had passed by this place a million times, each time disappointed that it had not opened yet. The exterior looked complete with their sign hanging up and the hours posted on the door, but the interior was not fully constructed. When I finally heard that this place was open, I was ecstatic to have a nearby ramen place. The place is new, so of course it was clean. The ramen is pricey at $13 per bowl, but slightly cheaper than uptown ramen prices. I was not a fan of the noodles themselves because I prefer more texture/waviness. These were fairly straight and resembled spaghetti noodles. I had their Tonkotsu Ramen (braised pork belly, egg, cabbage, bean sprouts, onion, fish cake, pickled ginger, sesame seed, scallion, and garlic oil in pork broth). It's not too often that I see cabbage and bean sprouts with ramen, but they added a nice little crunch. The broth was a little disappointing and not as rich as I would have liked. It's usually the star of ramen dishes, but sadly, it was not. Portion size is good. Staff is attentive and friendly. Perhaps my expectations were simply too high since I was awaiting their opening for so long.

S90l01wULcjuJbJr-uwvVg.text: First time to this little gem. I have wanted to go for a couple of days, and it is a nice clean ramen place. It has easy parking and lots of seats inside. We had Two different kinds of Ramen. We had the Spicy Tonkotsu and the Spicy Miso Ramen. We started with Gyoza for the kids and they were delicious. Then came our Ramen in beautiful big bowls. Graced with eggs and fresh ginger, the Tonkotsu had Pork Belly in it and the Miso Ramen had ground chicken. I feel like the seasoning could have been a little more flavorful, and maybe for 14.00 and 13,00 a little more meat. The Chili Paste they give you on the side is great and very spicy. We also ordered The Yakitori to go and the Curry Ramen which has Chicken Katsu in it.  All in all It is a welcome addition to the South Side. I wish they had Homemade Noodles but I will take these. They do need to add some vegetarian dishes to the menu. For the Veg Heads!

FBonRxebs1N-0V_bnjhGVw.text: This place is the closest to the ramen I had in Japan. Much better than other spots in the city. Definitely recommend

Wp80-Yxn5blEV_svc5M-4g.text: Finally! A yummy ramen place. We ordered the tonkatsu, spicy miso, and shoyu ramen. Each one was delicious, but I would say my favorite would be the tonkatsu. The wait was a bit long when we came in, even though the host told us it would only be 10 minutes. It also took a while to get our food and we ordered as soon as we sat down. Otherwise, great ambiance, friendly service, affordable delicious ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

040CUN9dmet60xnof8u92w.text: This is now my new favorite ramen restaurant. Simple, Clean and close to my house that I don't need to drive to Uptown Charlotte if I'm craving for ramen. We ordered some Takoyaki, Shoyu, Spicy Miso, Tonkotsu and Curry Ramen. The broth are so delicious and flavorful. Definitely, We're  coming back to try the rest on the menu. I highly recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

b7YZo7YhoRByEwTMTnnXUQ.text: I don't live in Charlotte so when I'm in town I love to try the local spots. The food was so excellent here for a good price! The ramen was authentic, fresh, and came out quick. I loved the flavor of the broth and the chicken inside of it was on point. A well decorated place, that was extremely clean! They have other options as well if you don't love Ramen. The one thing that was disappointing was they charge you by the can for sodas. I wanted a refill but didn't want to pay another $2.25. :( a small complaint, so if that concerns you I would just get water! Service was wonderful as well. When I'm back in town I would love to come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paitan Ramen

CZ6xCZCr2GV0_l-Fg6uA_A.text: This place is very good if you are eating in. Food is fantastic. On the other hand if you are doing takeout it can be subpar. Service is very slow as we went out for lunch with the office and did not get our food till after 40 minutes after the order was placed. I really hope they can improve their times as we would come back in to eat, but won't take out again.

wQggMGRE7V35gdI866dJGQ.text: Loved Shang ramen! Ramen was good but loved the dumplings, takoyaki, and pork buns! So good! Would love to see the menu expand and add more traditional Japanese dishes.

iUAf9q4TvfxX2Uc2Zew65A.text: I have always been a ramen fan, ever since I was a kid my mother would make ramen on cold days so that the broth would warm me up.  It did not matter if it was the packaged deep fried ramen or the Kimchi Jjigae that used the Nong Shim Shin Ramyun noodle, ramen was always something that was quick and tasty in my parent's house.  That is why, whenever I hear there is a Ramen shop that is close by where I am, I have to go and try out their ramen, and Sheng Ramen does not disappoint.  I was seated immediately and was promptly asked by the waitress about my drink order, which is a plus for me.  The waitress was patient and would answer any questions I had about the menu in general.  Her attention was very good and after I had finished ordering, she would repeat it to verify that my order was correct, another plus.  Finally when my meal was done, she was very prompt in getting the dishes off my table and providing my check to me.  Now about my meal, I started by ordering two of my favorite:  The pork belly bao and takoyaki.  They both came out at the same time and were piping hot.    The bao were soft, the pork belly was tender, but the addition of lettuce and cucumber was surprising. As soon as you bite into the bao, the pork belly was very tasty and only required the slightest of chew, which the lettuce and cucumber provided.  The cucumber added a cooling, refreshing addition to the bao.  And the sauce was on point, completing the bao and bringing the different components together.  The takoyaki came with the bonito shavings and the mayonnaise and Japanese 'Worchester' sauce, and sitting on a bed of thinly sliced cabbage. It looked very appetizing, as the bonito shavings moved from the heat the takoyaki produced.  The takoyaki was extremely hot and I had to employ the Japanese 'ho ho ho' to puff out the heat and make the takoyaki easier to eat. That is one of the thing I enjoy about takoyaki.  The octopus was cooked thoroughly and provided the slight chew.  The batter was extremely tasty with the outer coating slightly charred but the inside still soft and gooey. Overall a standard takoyaki, but still a very good choice for those that like takoyaki.  Finally my main order arrived, curry ramen...  Something that at the time was new to me as I always order the Tonkotsu ramen, but I do love a good curry and this did not disappoint.  The curry was a yellow curry watered down to a soup base, but still retaining the standard curry taste.  The ramen contained a chicken Katsu cutlet two medium boiled eggs, corn, cabbage, bean sprouts, onion, and scallions.  The chicken Katsu was crunchy and light.  The ramen noodles were chewy and was able to hold on to the curry broth.  The corn added sweetness and a soft crunch.  The egg was a medium boiled egg that you see in all ramen shops in Japan. The cabbage and bean sprouts added crunch even after been in the curry broth for a while. The scallion and onion provided an added texture to the ramen.  Overall the ramen was extremely flavorful, and one that I will definitely come back for again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Takoyaki.
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly Bao/Bun
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry Ramen

ICCgZE6gG0JEFaS9kK9l3g.text: I still remember waiting for this place to open. When it finally open, I went right the way. However, it was not as good as I thought. So I gave it another try couple of months later.  This time, the food was good and service was a lot better. Charlotte has a lot of Ramen Place now, I will consider this as ok, it is in the Ballantyne area, since there two other restaurant in the area serves Ramen. The soup base taste good in my opinion needs to be more rich in favor.  Taste: 3.5 out of 5 Good taste, it has room for improvement   Environment: 4 out of 5 Clean and comfortable   Service: 4 out of 5 Friendly and food came fast  Value: 2.5 out of 5 $13 to $14 for bowl of Ramen, it is expensive with tips and tax, you will spending close to $20 for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZBF9FBITiaV-sfX3F0fB_A.text: Sunday afternoon the restaurant was busy, however the four of us wee able to be seated right away. When we asked about the hotpot, the waitress did not have any knowledge of the type of broth. I would recommend the owner to educate all waiters about the dishes that they serve.   We order the tonkatsu ramen, beef hotpot and chicken katsu. The broth of the ramen was tasty. The texture of the ramen is too soft and more similar to Chinese noodle. I heard from my Japanese friend that you can ask for the chewy one. The hot pot was nothing special and the beef was tough. The portion of the katsu was large, however it was oily and it seemed that they have not replaced the oils from a long time.  I will give it another try in the future.

sqqo3NuflKRtIM3OU7EYyA.text: Best lil ramen shop in Charlotte! Great service and beautiful tasty food. I brought my boys here for their first ramen experience and they loved it!   Can't wait to come back for some more goodness!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

L19O2gUOLYr9yPBXkXn78w.text: Sadly I wasn't super impressed with the ramen here. It was decent, but nothing special. I got the shoyu ramen  and the broth was decent. I felt it had more flavor than the tonkotsu which my boyfriend let me try. The egg was marinated well but a little overdone for my taste. The pork belly tasted good, but seemed very dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoyu Ramen

Er5ww4rby-r0BrJrbxgN0A.text: For some reason I have yet to have Ramen in my life. I know, kind of amazing right? I've had almost every other noodle dish under the sun. I also watched a lot of Naruto, so I've always wanted to see what he was so hyped about.   That brings me to today. I took the plunge and decided that I wanted to go to Sheng Ramen. Ramen was in their name, so I was sure the Ramen would be good. Not only was it good, it was great! It was everything I hoped it would be. So good in fact, I won't shut up about it. Just ask my wife, she'll tell you! The noodles, the broth, the fish cake, all of it. I want it to be apart of my weekly meal plan.   With all seriousness, the place was great and I would recommend it for sure. Get a Ramune too. Sure it taste like pure candy, but go for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

mVBwLp5GkVMdBUaih1D4Tw.text: I was going to initially give this place a 4 star review but after my most recent visit, we were not as excited as our first visit.   What we hands down love is the Steak Yakitori. These steak kabobs are an abundance of flavor and tenderness on a stick. These are literally the most perfect bite one could ever ask for. These are a must for every visit.   The Pork Belly Buns on our first visit were amazing. The second visit, the recipe had slightly changed and we didn't love them as much. They were still good but they had way too much sauce on them this time and the balance of flavors were not there like previously.   The veggie eggrolls are good, flavored with a hint of curry and always served piping hot.   The dumplings are good, crispy on the bottom and juicy and delicious on the inside. However, they were not anything to go crazy about. I wouldn't come here just for those.   The soups on our first visit were amazing delicious and so very tasty. The second visit, the broth just seemed a bit different and not as wonderful.   The service here is great, the waitresses do a great job of making sure everything is good and ensuring you have what you need.   They do have bento boxes and hot pots too, if ramen is not your thing. We also tried the chicken yakisoba which was okay. The noodles are the same as what you would find in the ramen but the chicken was a bit on the bland side.   Overall, this is a good ramen house. You can satiate the craving for ramen if you've got a hankering.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu Ramen with spicy chili paste
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly Bun

I-brv-qVhkhN3b7MbwLwGA.text: YYYYOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! I love this place. OMG! I just discovered it like a week ago and I've already made two trips out here. Where can I start? The ramen bowls are delicious. I ate them joints like I was Naruto returning to the Hidden Leaf Village after completing an A Rank mission.   The seating is cool because in addition to the tables they have a counter with some seats where you can see the food being prepared or around the corner for the True introverts like myself. The place is clean and new with some nice decor.   We had appetizers in addition to our ramen bowls and I'm happy to report they were all amazing.The Yakitori stole the show especially the steak Yakitori. You should get that if you get a chance. I'd recommend it over all the other apps even though all the apps are great. The gyoza, spring rolls and takoyaki blew my socks off as well.   I like this place so much that we went to a restaurant in walking distance. And as we were looking at the menus deciding what to get my heat wouldn't stop longing for Sheng Ramen. I stood up like a man in a Rom Com who just realized that the once in a lifetime love of his life is about to board a plane back to her hometown. I jumped up and ran out of the door to my True love... Sheng Ramen.   My wife got up to make apologies to the other restaurant but love doesn't care about second place. I said "Do whatever you need to do Karen. I'll be at Sheng Ramen!"   I ran jumped over a few cars and dogged some luggage racks to make it over to Sheng's where I immediately got down on one knee, pulled out and engagement ring and ordered a Tunkotsu Ramen bowl. It's that serious guys.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

hHxrT98t-f05ieSrwIUHnQ.text: I went out to eat here with my family. The interior is very reminiscent of a traditional Japanese ramen shop (coming from someone who has visited the country). We were seated right away. Our waiter was attentive and polite. My dad and sister got ramen, my mom got a bento box, and I got the veggie yakisoba. My food was surprisingly flavorful for such a simple dish. Everyone enjoyed their meal. My dad said it wasn't the best ramen he's had in Charlotte, but that it was definitely good. Overall, a good dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable yakisoba
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mural

1jIKo6D3nfSTm5N3nopeGw.text: Wow! I am a HUGE ramen fan and Sheng Ramen did not disappoint at all. I honestly haven't had this good of ramen since I've been in NYC.   My family and I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen, Shoyu Ramen, and Curry Ramen. I got to taste all three and all three were delicious. The pork belly in the Tonkotsu and Shoyu were grilled and cooked to absolute perfection and the flavor was amazing. I also wanted to point out how delicious and beautifully cooked the eggs were. My sister is a vegetarian and substituted the chicken in the curry ramen for the tofu and that was also very yummy. All of the dishes we ordered had lots of vegetables and plenty of noodles all cooked and seasoned very well.   The broth/soup for the Tonkotsu was very fresh and the flavors were impressive because they tasted like a real ramen broth. The soup in the Shoyu was also delicious but has a hint of chicken stock which I was 100% fine with.   I would recommend the Tonkotsu over the Shoyu if you want a stronger flavor but I absolutely loved both!  Lastly, the presentation was very nice and the design of the restaurant was very pretty with a painted mural. I also appreciated that they used actual wooden chopsticks and wooden soup spoons instead of take out ones like most ramen places give you. I will definitely come back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoyu Ramen
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu Ramen

hwNaly9aGf05yonELawz7g.text: Holy heaven and all that is good in the world, the NC ramen gods have FINALLY heard my prayer and have given us a DELICIOUS ramen joint!!!!!!!  Ordered the Tonkotsu ramen extra spicy. Broth: so flavorful and delicious.  Noodles: perfect thickness and bite. Shoyu egg: cooked beautifully Chashu: perfectly caramelized, delicious flavor   Partner got the curry ramen and he didn't say a world until his bowl was clean.   Needless to say. We will be back!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goyza
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tonkotsu ramen
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Curry ramen

g-PE0UQXlabJwhDZls9o7g.text: It's a sweet Easter miracle! Ballantyne has a ramen restaurant. I mean, yes, there is the counter located in Whole Foods on Providence...but THIS...  They have Pork Belly Buns.   And Shoyu Ramen. And Tonkatsu Ramen.   Maybe I feel like crying because this pork flavored broth feels so good in my gullet on this rainy spring day. Maybe it's because it's like a nice soft towel straight from the dryer, after spending all day at Carowinds...on a Saturday...during Spring Break.   Whatever. It's good. GOOD. Like the Savior's love good.   Happy Easter.

_R7uykYGAfvn-wXkSedfgQ.text: Going into Sheng Ramen I had absolutely no idea what to get and what to expect, other than me hearing nothing but awesome reviews from friends. Once sitting down we asked the waitress for suggestions and any questions we had about each entree. I finally decided on the pork belly ramen which was AMAZING! We also ordered the gyoza which weren't bad, however the sauce for it was yummy. Can't wait to go back and try more RAMEN.... super happy they chose to come to the Ballantyne area we need a Ramen place in the area because OMG is it yummy !

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

W4t9gViNsdF2ONggPdtkFQ.text: Excellent place! The staff were very friendly and quick. The food was AMAZING! Three of us had ordered three different ramen dishes, we spent the meal snatching bites off of each others plates because it was all so good. I highly recommend this place. I have to go to California or NYC to find a similar experience.

uacP__ax4o9mpoMNH2O-JA.text: The broth is delicious, dishes are flavorful a and colorful. The place is super clean and staff is very friendly. I will keep coming back and you should try it too!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

i48Gtvziq_vjMZCSPWwg8A.text: Great ramen, Chinese owner but Japanese receipe. Love the tonkonshu ramen. Place is a good vibe, bright and clean. Staff is friendly and prices are fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Octopus appetizer

EcJmItgsMpTB7T8k1dd8SA.text: Life changing! Lol I had herd about this place when I lived in Florida but every time I would come to NC I would eat somewhere else. Today, my husband and I decided to give it a shot and boy, was that a good decision. This is unbelievably good. I had the curry one and it was a party of flavors going on in my mouth. Not too spicy but spicy enough, the noodles were cooked perfectly and the service was incredible. I had a server who was the sweetest. Her name was Callie. Also, it was so much Food that I wasn't able to finish it and that is something that does not happen a lot because I CAN EAT. I'll be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States

wkiZ94JcjenD3R9Cy-YKuQ.text: My NC Ramen prayers have finally answered *sheds tear*. JUST discovered Sheng last week and after "much needed" convincing from all the friends who could not stop raving about this place, I had to go immediately! Twist my arm, I know.   We started the meal off with taboyaki, the classic octopus balls. Perfect balance of flavors and a great octopus to dough ratio. First sign of a good ramen spot? They give you a ladle for your ramen. We went with the traditional Tonkatsu Ramen and another Tonkatsu Ramen with a spicy bomb added as our entrees. Usually I'm hesitant to add the spicy bombs to any ramen as it alters the flavors.. but it was just calling my name! I loveeee spicy foods! I'm glad I went with the spicy addition because it was the perfect balance and did not disrupt the Tonkatsu equilibrium (it exists). It also had a nice garlic flavor to it. I wouldn't say this is my favorite Ramen spot ever as it doesn't compare to the ones I've had in DC and NY, but dare I say best in Charlotte? Bold statement, I know. Can't wait to go back and try the other ramen dishes, bento box, hot pot and yakitori! Good/bad thing this place is less than 5 minutes from work!

riWKU8q--euPsMQJVEJf6w.text: This place is cute. The ramen was really good. I ordered the Shoyu. I definitely recommend this place, if you like Ramen.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shoyu Ramen

R31QEp6PRGeRpbsFEqCaiA.text: Finally we got a Ramen shop! And a pretty good one at that. I like the fact that they specialize. A lot of places you go into have way too many offerings. This place has got Ramen, Mini Hot Pot, Bento Boxes, Yakisoba ,appetizers and only about 25 items on the menu. So far I've had the Gyoza, Edename, Curry Ramen and Shoyu Ramen. All were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Sheng Ramen - Charlotte, NC, United States. They were out of Lemonata so I got the Blood Orange.
